noun.description: A maker of artillery; specifically a maker of bows.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Brut. From Anglo-Norman and Middle French artillier maker of bows and arrows from artillier + -ier; compare -er. Compare post-classical Latin artillarius maker or supervisor of artillery, and also Catalan artiller, Spanish artillero, Portuguese artilheiro, Italian † artegliero, † artigliero, artigliere.
